div.p: Yours of the 14th inst was recd on the 18th and is the only one since yours of the 4th recd the 8th, I am glad the draft arriv in good time on Wed 14th I sent by Express $150, and on the 7th $200 also by Express both which I hope will get to hand safely and the amount will pay all the small debt your letters are veryirregular in getting here - at one time I recd two letters the same day one of which was 33 days later than the other, I suppose however that most of them come to hand at last, When I left I olut I our d as well as I can u collect as follow
Virgil 2 notes - one about 20 the other about 19
Curry - 2 notes one forty the other I forgot
Gainter 50 note and perhaps a few dollars

fox - 10 - Sanage 5 - Tom Cagruin about 100 - a small bill ah - Browns bugget Dewey $ 5 which are all that I recollect, you complain that I do not answer your questions but I have not time to answer when I receive them and sometimes they are so old that I omit and write just what comes to hand, I want ou to get a receipt full to date when everyone pays a bill

Mr Yeatman has left us and i have been to se his succesor Mr Tomeny Tomeny who I hope will not turn me out for I am doing well and in a few nine weeks will pay off all I own and then get some on hand for future use I think that Hattie had better go to Bloomington on a visit and see if she caught

board for you all or a house that will suit you or if you choose until the house Lufkin is in if Jacky will put up the fence an any rute lean the one you are in, had you not better go back to - as goods hours- suit yourself but at any rate get away from the one you are in in april for it is not fit to live in. I am sorry Bill husack so but I feared it and am glad you have got rid of him for good he cannot be trusted in going to Bloomington you might if you get board furnish your own rooms and start the Books and other things have the books packed for moving - Buckinrig has 1 box of coke in Littleton - Simons Appletins Factory of Brognaphy whose he will start if he can - and number of others win out - with the names of the prisons who had them in clips of pope

which I suppose are but in marring the Books - open my desk with one of your keys if you can - if not break it and take the papers home - in one of the Pigeon holes you will find Darcys papers - give him the small bundle containing the Kenedy papers Keep the other two - Get Zurly to take my record book and see what I owe the city and pay it - The Liasius receipt and the large packet book in the desk in the middle drawer (which open in the same way) you will find my private papers, Bills and receipts - take all papers home and put them away I am sorry my love that I have to put this work on you but you will now have money to pay some one to do the hard work until all is paid Love and kisses to all send your Photograph.
